April 01, 2013

New Website

I decided to use Jekyll for my new website. Jekyll is a static site generator which means there’s no database to manage, I can write all of my posts in Markdown and use git for version control and to push updates to my server. I really didn’t want to use Wordpress for my new site because compared to Jekyll, Wordpress just feels like a brick.

If using a static site generator sounds interesting to you but you’re not sure where to begin, this tutorial got me up and running and the Jekyll Wiki has everything else.

Made by Josh Fry
